title: Angelo State Summer Nursing Discovery Camp 9.0
description: Nursing Discovery Camp 9.0 is designed for students entering 9th grade this August who are interested in exploring an exciting and rewarding career in nursing.

paragraphs: Discovery Camp 9.0 is designed for students entering 9th grade this August who are interested in exploring an exciting and rewarding career in nursing.
This is a residential camp, and students will be housed in ASU’sPlaza Verderesidence hall.
Cost:$425 per person
The cost includes tuition and fees, housing, meals and swag.
Nursing Discovery Camp 9.0 has two areas of emphasis, each with its own objectives.
Students will be immersed in the world of nursing and nurse education. They will:
We will help you plan for the best 9th grade year ever by exploring a variety of topics, including:
While the main objectives of the camp are educational, it is also meant to be fun. Activities will include:

Please note, students are not allowed to leave campus during the camp. Once students are dropped off, we provide a safe and controlled atmosphere. Besides, you’re at camp! Take this opportunity to get to know other campers and enjoy the facilities.
Students will be under constant supervision by Summer Nursing Discovery Camp 9.0 staff, including ASU faculty, staff and students. Your student’s safety and well-being are our utmost concern.
Students will be housed in ASU’s award-winningPlaza Verderesidence hall.
All meals will be served in the university cafeteria, The Caf, featuring an all-you-can-eat buffet and various specialty dining options. It is just a short walk from Plaza Verde.

Check in will run from 3-5 p.m. on Sunday, June 9, at thePlaza Verderesidence hall. Camp counselors will be there to direct you where to park and help you sign in. Please do not unload luggage at this time.
Dinner will be served to all campers on Sunday from 5-6:15 p.m. in The Caf. Camp activities will begin at 6:30 p.m. with a general camp meeting in Plaza Verde.

Arriving on time is essential. Students must be checked in to the camp and moved into their rooms before the 6:30 p.m. camp meeting begins. We will hand out the schedules when you check in, and then go over the camp goals and safety items at the camp meeting.
One Note:Camp activities will conclude at 9:30 p.m. each night.

Please label your luggage with your name and address using luggage tags or masking tape. A small quantity of snacks is okay, but there are vending machines available. Change for the vending machines is helpful. HINT: $15 is probably not enough, $100 is too much.

We recognize that sometimes plans change and you must withdraw your child from camp. Cancellations and reductions in registrations must be made to the Camp Director via phone or email (325-942-2224 ornursingcamp@angelo.edu), and are subject to the following:

Medical Cancellation:All campers are subject to the above policies; however, concessions will be made in the event of an unavoidable medical cancellation. Should you need to cancel your registration on medical grounds we ask that you provide a signed medical note from your physician and that you contact the Summer Camp Director directly to discuss the cancellation. In a case of major illness, injury, or serious family situation while at camp, refunds will be provided minus administrative fees and the days spent at camp.
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.

Course DescriptionsBachelor of Science in NursingMaster of Science in Nursing
Learn from ASU nursing faculty and students.
Interact with practicing RNs in different specialty areas.
Experience how nurses use knowledge of anatomy and physiology, math and systems to care for patients.
Gain hands-on experience with state-of-the-art, AI-supported patient simulators.
Interact with healthcare team members - physical therapists, social workers, athletic trainers and counseling psychologists.
Learn more about ASU and our Bachelor of Science in Nursing (B.S.N.) program.
Complete American Heart Association CPR and First Aid training.
Engaging in your high school community
A great attitude, excitement to learn and desire to make new friends.
Two bed sheets, one blanket, one pillow, one pillowcase, towels, washcloths, deodorant, and other personal toiletry items. (Optional: sleeping bag instead of sheets/blanket)
Comfortable jeans, athletic pants or shorts and shoes suitable for indoor lab and outdoor activities.
A swim suit for pool activities. We will be using the university pool.
In order to receive a full cash refund, enrollment must be withdrawn or canceled on or before May 1, 2024.
Cancellation requests made on May 2, 2024 until June 2, 2024, shall receive only a 50% refund.
Any cancellations made after June 2, 2024 shall be considered forfeited in favor of the camp and will not receive a refund.
Cancellations after the start date of a class will not receive a refund. Nor can we offer a refund or credit for late, non-arrival, or early withdrawal after the start date of any class.
